results.title: The Odds against
results.creator_credit: Helen Kirstt Radin and Lee R. Bobker
results.brief_description: Explores the correctional system in the United States, including detention, probation, imprisonment and parole. Shows a contrast between older institutions and modern facilities and methods throughout the country. Narrated by Herschel Bernardi.

results.title: The Occupant
results.creator_credit: Masterthief Enterprises, Peter Lyssiotis, Ettore Siracusa and Michael Karris
results.brief_description: An experimental look at the migrant experience through the alienation of a Greek photographer. The photographer, Peter Lyssiotis, with memories of his homeland Cyprus, his relationship with his father and fantasies based in the photographer’s everyday life is well known for his work in photography, photomontage and photo books. He recently collaborated with Ettore Siracusa and Michael Karaglanidis on this film which explores some of the themes and practices of his photographic work.

results.title: The Objectives of criminal punishment
results.creator_credit: Video Classroom, Geoff Russell and Peter Wiseman
results.brief_description: What is the objective of criminal sanctions imposed on individuals found guilty of breaking the community’s laws? Reveals the many dilemmas faced by our legal systemin balancing society’s expectation for protection (and the punishment and rehabilitation of offenders) against the rights of the criminal in order to ultimately reach a ‘just’ outcome. Explores and evaluates the goals of the criminal justice system: Community Protection, Reform, Rehabilitation, Deterrence, Retribution. Includes teacher’s notes.

results.title: The Obedient flame
results.creator_credit: John Grierson, Science Film and Norman McLaren
results.brief_description: Charming promotional film extolling the virtues of gas cooking through a series of simple animations. Gender stereotypes are anachronistic, but innocent rather than patronising - intended audience was contemperaneous “housewives”. McLaren’s animations employ an economical graphic style strongly influenced by the art deco and industrial aesthetics of the day - as always, stiking and appealing. The last film Norman McLaren made in the United Kingdom.

results.title: The Oath and the man: a story of the French Revolution
results.brief_description: A tale of love and revenge set in Paris during the French Revolution. Cast includes Edward Dillon, Marion Leonard, Arthur V. Johnson, Florence Barker, Henry B. Walthall, Francis J. Grandon. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Nutcracker
results.creator_credit: Peter Wright, BBC-TV, National Video Corporation and John Vernon
results.brief_description: The Royal Ballet at the Royal Opera House Covent Garden presents this beautiful magical production by Peter Wright of the classic fairytale “The Nutcracker” by E.T.A. Hoffmann, with music by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky performed by the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House Covent Garden, conducted by Gennady Rozhdestvensky, and choreography by Lev Ivanov and Peter Wright. Two of the Royal Ballet’s leading principals, Lesley Collier and Anthony Dowell appear as the Sugar Plum Fairy and her Prince, supported by Michael Coleman (Herr Drosselmeyer), Julie Rose (Clara), Guy Niblett (the Nutcracker) and artists and students of the Royal Ballet Schools along with the London Oratory Junior Choir directed by Patrick Russill.

results.title: The Nutcracker
results.brief_description: Maree, a poor servant girl, helps Prince Nathaniel overcome an evil spell which has turned him into a toy nutcracker and frozen his kingdom in time. Hoffmann’s tale is set to Tschaikovsky’s music.

results.title: The Numbers game
results.creator_credit: Peter Hollander, University of the State of New York and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Discusses cancer and other diseases being associated with man’s environment, posing the alternativew between benefits of modern technology and their potential health hazards.

results.title: The Nuclear structure of the atom
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Atomic physics: an historical approach”.
Part three of a five part series designed for use in the science departments of universities, technical colleges and schools teaching advanced physics. Shows the work which culminated in Rutherford’s theory of the nuclear structure of the atom.
